vc.prottype: FWLIBAPI short WINAPI pmc_wrpmcrng(unsigned short FlibHndl, short length,IODBPMC *buf);

cmn.p:
Writes the PMC data of the specified PMC address/range.
This function is used to exchange the data between the application on MMC function and LADDER software on PMC.

content.p: Specify the library handle. See "Library handle" for details.

item.name: length
item.content:
Specify the data block length.
data_type is 0(byte type) : length = 8 + N
data_type is 1(word type) : length = 8 + N × 2
data_type is 2(long type) : length = 8 + N × 4
data_type is 4(32-bit floating-point type) : length = 8 + N × 4
data_type is 5(64-bit floating-point type) : length = 8 + N × 8
* N is the number of written data.

item.name: buf
item.content:
Pointer to the IODBPMC structure.
The IODBPMC structure is as follows.
In case of using PMC memory D in Series 0i-F, 30i/31i/32i/35i-B, PMi-A, define character constant "PMCMEMD" at compiling by the '-D' option.
#if defined (PMCMEMD) typedef struct iodbpmc { short type_a ; /* Kind of PMC address */ short type_d ; /* Type of the PMC data */ unsigned short datano_s ; /* Start PMC address number */ unsigned short datano_e ; /* End PMC address number */ union { char cdata[N] ;/* The PMC data(byte type) */ short idata[N] ;/* (word type) */ long ldata[N] ;/* (long type) */ float fdata[N] ; /* (32-bit floating-point type)*/ double dfdata[N]; /* (64-bit floating-point type)*/ } u ; /* N is the number of read data */ } IODBPMC ; #else typedef struct iodbpmc { short type_a ; /* Kind of PMC address */ short type_d ; /* Type of the PMC data */ short datano_s ; /* Start PMC address number */ short datano_e ; /* End PMC address number */ union { char cdata[N] ;/* The PMC data(byte type) */ short idata[N] ;/* (word type) */ long ldata[N] ;/* (long type) */ float fdata[N] ; /* (32-bit floating-point type)*/ double dfdata[N]; /* (64-bit floating-point type)*/ } u ; /* N is the number of written data */ } IODBPMC ; #endif
type_a Specify the identification code corresponding to the kind of the PMC address. type_d Specify the type of the PMC data.
It must be the same one as the type of data of the PMC side.
0:Byte type
1:Word type
2:Long type
4:32-bit floating-point type(30i-B Series/0i-F/PMi-A only)
5:64-bit floating-point type(30i-B Series/0i-F/PMi-A only)
datano_s Specify the start PMC address number. datano_e Specify the end PMC address number.
See "The referenceable range of PMC data" of "Read PMC data(area specified) (pmc_rdpmcrng)" about the kind of the PMC address, the start address, and the end address.

ol.li: 250 is written in D0100(It is assumed the word type)
0 is written all of R0200,..,R0209(It is assumed byte type)
1.1 is written in D0100(It is assumed 32-bit floating-point type)
-2.2 and 33.3 are written in R104, R112(It is assumed 64-bit floating-point type)

item.name: EW_LENGTH
item.content:
Data block length error
Size of IODBPMC structure(length) is wrong.

item.name: EW_RANGE
item.content:
Address range error
Address range error PMC address number(datano_s,datano_e) is wrong.

item.name: EW_ATTRIB
item.content:
Data attribute error
Kind of PMC address(type_a) or type of PMC data (type_d) is wrong.

item.name: EW_PASSWD
item.content:
The data of specified range cannot be written because the data is protected.
(Series 16i/18i/21i, 0i-A/B/C)

option.hssb: The extended driver/library function is necessary.

ethr.p: The Ethernet function and the extended driver/library function are necessary.
However, in case of Series 16i/18i/21i-B, 0i-B/C/D/F, Series 30i and PMi-A, the required CNC option is as follows.

p.ul: above two optional functions are not required.
